situation.name: Supplication
stories: The suppliant appeals to the power in authority for deliverance from the persecutor.

situation.name: Deliverance
stories: The unfortunate has caused a conflict, and the threatener is to carry out justice, but the rescuer saves the unfortunate.

situation.name: Crime pursued by vengeance
stories: The criminal commits a crime that will not see justice, so the avenger seeks justice by punishing the criminal.

situation.name: Vengeance taken for kin upon kin
stories: Two entities, the Guilty and the Avenging Kinsmen, are put into conflict over wrongdoing to the Victim, who is allied to both.

situation.name: Pursuit
stories: The fugitive flees punishment for a misunderstood conflict.

situation.name: Disaster
stories: The vanquished power falls from their place after being defeated by the victorious enemy or being informed of such a defeat by the messenger.

situation.name: Falling prey to cruelty/misfortune
stories: The unfortunate suffers at the hands of the master.

situation.name: Revolt
stories: The tyrant, a cruel power, is plotted against by the conspirator.

situation.name: Daring enterprise
stories: The bold leader takes the object from the adversary by overpowering the adversary.

situation.name: Abduction
stories: The abductor takes the abducted from the guardian.

situation.name: The enigma
stories: The interrogator poses a problem to the seeker and gives a seeker better ability to reach the seeker's goals.

situation.name: Obtaining
stories: The solicitor is at odds with the adversary who refuses to give the solicitor an object in the possession of the adversary

situation.name: Enmity of kin
stories: The Malevolent Kinsman and the Hated or a second Malevolent Kinsman conspire together.

situation.name: Rivalry of kin
stories: The Object of Rivalry chooses the Preferred Kinsman over the Rejected Kinsman.

situation.name: Murderous adultery
stories: Two Adulterers conspire to kill the Betrayed Spouse.

situation.name: Madness
stories: The Madman goes insane and wrongs the Victim.

situation.name: Fatal imprudence
stories: The Imprudent, by neglect or ignorance, loses the Object Lost or wrongs the Victim.

situation.name: Involuntary crimes of love
stories: The Lover and the Beloved have unknowingly broken a taboo through their romantic relationship, and the Revealer reveals this to them.

situation.name: Slaying of kin unrecognized
stories: The Slayer kills the Unrecognized Victim.

situation.name: Self-sacrifice for an ideal
stories: The Hero sacrifices the Person or Thing for their Ideal, which is then taken by the Creditor.

situation.name: Self-sacrifice for kin
stories: The Hero sacrifices a Person for their Kinsman, which is then taken by the Creditor.

situation.name: All sacrificed for passion
stories: A Lover sacrifices a Person for the Object of their Passion, which is then lost forever.

situation.name: Necessity of sacrificing loved ones
stories: The Hero wrongs the Beloved Victim because of the Necessity for their Sacrifice.

situation.name: Rivalry of superior vs. inferior
stories: An Inferior Rival bests a Superior Rival and wins the Object of Rivalry.

situation.name: Adultery
stories: Two Adulterers conspire against the Deceived Spouse.

situation.name: Crimes of love
stories: A Lover and the Beloved break a taboo by initiating a romantic relationship.

situation.name: Discovery of the dishonour of a loved one
stories: The Discoverer discovers the wrongdoing committed by the Guilty One.

situation.name: Obstacles to love
stories: Two Lovers face an Obstacle together.

situation.name: An enemy loved
stories: The allied Lover and Hater have diametrically opposed attitudes towards the Beloved Enemy.

situation.name: Ambition
stories: The Ambitious Person seeks the Thing Coveted and is opposed by the Adversary.

situation.name: Conflict with a god
stories: The Mortal and the Immortal enter a conflict.

situation.name: Mistaken jealousy
stories: The Jealous One falls victim to the Author of the Mistake and becomes jealous of the Object and becomes conflicted with the Supposed Accomplice.

characters.character: Object of whose Possession He is Jealous

situation.name: Erroneous judgment
stories: The Mistaken One falls victim to the Author of the Mistake and passes judgment against the Victim of the Mistake when it should be passed against the Guilty One instead.

situation.name: Remorse
stories: The Culprit wrongs the Victim, and is at odds with the Interrogator who seeks to understand the situation.

situation.name: Recovery of a lost one
stories: The Seeker finds the One Found.

situation.name: Loss of loved ones
stories: The killing of the Kinsman Slain by the Executioner is witnessed by the Kinsman.
